items.title: Porsche’s next Taycan gets an infotainment upgrade — but no new CarPlay
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- The 2026 Taycan, 911, Panamera, and Cayenne will have an upgraded infotainment system with the Porsche Communication Management (PCM) software.
- New system includes Amazon Alexa for personal assistance and will be available in the Macan Electric.
- The models still use the traditional CarPlay; no mention of the new-generation CarPlay.
- Features include Dolby Atmos support in models with premium audio systems like Bose.
- 10 years of Porsche Connect service included to enhance the digital user experience.
- The vehicles can be ordered now and are set to arrive in US stores by late summer 2025.

items.title: Microsoft adds ‘deep reasoning’ Copilot AI for research and data analysis
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Microsoft introduced two deep reasoning agents, Researcher and Analyst, for Microsoft 365 Copilot.
- Researcher utilizes OpenAI's model for complex research and connects to third-party data like Salesforce.
- Analyst, based on OpenAI's o3-mini reasoning model, can create spreadsheets and run Python code, functioning at a data scientist's level.
- The rollout for these tools starts in April as part of an early access program for Microsoft 365 Copilot users.
- New capabilities for autonomous agents in Copilot Studio are also being released now, aimed at automating various tasks with AI.

items.title: Character.ai can now tell parents which bots their kid is talking to
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- Character.AI introduces a ‘Parental Insights’ feature allowing teens to send weekly usage reports to parents.
- The report includes average daily usage time, frequently interacted characters, and time spent with each character.
- The feature is optional and doesn’t require parents to have an account; it provides an activity overview without sharing conversation content.
- Character.AI aims to address concerns over excessive chatbot use and inappropriate content for minors.
- The platform restricts access for users under 13 or 16 in Europe and has implemented changes following legal complaints about content issues.
- Recent updates involve moving under-18 users to a safer model and increasing warnings about chatbot interactions not being with real people.

items.title: Google says its new ‘reasoning’ Gemini AI models are the best ones yet
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Google has introduced Gemini 2.5, an update to its AI models, improving performance with enhanced post-training capabilities.
- Gemini 2.5 Pro is reported to outpace competitors like OpenAI and Anthropic in various AI benchmarks, including understanding and mathematics.
- Gemini's multimodal capabilities allow it to interpret text, audio, images, video, and code, with a larger context window coming soon for better data processing.

items.title: EPA Workers Rally Against DOGE Cuts Amidst Deregulation Efforts
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- EPA workers protested in multiple cities against cuts imposed by President Trump and Elon Musk's DOGE, claiming these cuts jeopardize environmental protections.
- More than 150 workers rallied in New York City, chanting slogans and holding signs criticizing Musk.
- The protests were organized by union AFGE Council 238 on a 'National Day of Action' to combat planned rollbacks to regulatory measures aimed at pollution control.
- EPA now faces restrictions preventing it from taking enforcement actions unless there's an imminent health threat.
- Trump announced proposals that entail substantial deregulation efforts, aiming to roll back rules meant to curb pollution from various industries.
- Critics, including EPA employees, argue these actions undermine the agency's mission to protect human health and the environment, with calls for congressional action to intervene.

items.title: Amazon's Buy Two, Get One Free Deal on Movies
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon is offering a buy two, get one free deal on 4K Blu-rays, standard Blu-rays, and DVDs.
- The promotion allows customers to add three qualifying movies to their cart, with the cheapest one being free at checkout.
- The deal includes popular titles from 2024, such as *Nosferatu*, *The Substance*, and *Alien: Romulus*.
- To play 4K Blu-rays, buyers need a PlayStation 5 with a disc drive, an Xbox Series X, or a standalone 4K Blu-ray player.
- Other notable titles in the promotion include recent 4K re-releases of *Kill Bill*, *Akira*, and the *The Lord of the Rings* trilogy.

items.title: Game Informer has officially returned
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Game Informer is back online, acquired by Gunzilla Games.
- The magazine was previously owned by GameStop, which shuttered it last August.
- Editor-in-chief Matt Miller announced the return and future plans for the magazine.
- Game Informer will operate independently and will also revive its print edition.
- New membership benefits are planned, and the site will provide ongoing coverage of gaming news.

items.title: AT&T is slashing its autopay and paperless billing discounts
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Starting April 24th, AT&T will reduce its autopay discount from $10 to $5 for debit card users.
- The previous $5 discount for paperless billing and autopay customers with a credit card will be discontinued, now applying only to AT&T Plus Card holders from Citi.
- A $10 discount for autopay customers using bank accounts will remain in place.
- AT&T states this change is to align with industry standards, following similar adjustments by T-Mobile and Verizon.

items.title: The Kindle Colorsoft is now a far better deal thanks to Amazon’s Big Spring Sale
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- The Kindle Colorsoft is on sale for $224.99, reduced from the original price of $279.99.
- Sale valid from March 25, 2025.
- The Colorsoft features E Ink's first color display, 32GB storage, waterproofing, and wireless charging.
- Known for faster page turns, auto-adjusting front light, and long battery life of up to two months.
- Currently the only Kindle e-reader with color capabilities in the market.

items.title: Anker’s ‘InstaCord’ battery with dual retractable USB-C cables is 20 percent off
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Anker’s 25,000mAh portable battery, the InstaCord, is currently discounted by 20% to $87.99 from its original price of $109.99 during Amazon’s Big Spring Sale.
- The power bank features two retractable USB-C cables, one of which doubles as a carrying loop.
- It supports up to 165W total charging power and includes three USB-C ports and one USB-A port, allowing for charging multiple devices simultaneously.

items.title: GM-backed ‘coast-to-coast’ EV charging network grows to 130 locations
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- GM, EVgo, and Pilot have installed EV chargers at 130 locations across 25 states as part of a coast-to-coast charging network.
- The partnership aims to have 2,000 DC fast chargers at 500 Pilot and Flying J truck stop locations.
- The expanded network includes routes along I-75 and major highways between cities such as Minneapolis, Milwaukee, Detroit, Cleveland, San Antonio, Houston, Dallas, and Nashville.
- Each charging station is designed with gas station-style canopies and can accommodate multiple vehicles with fast charging capabilities.
- The charging system can provide a boost to compatible EVs in as little as 15 minutes, but typical charging times for most EVs range from 30 minutes for a 20-80% charge.

items.title: Why I love the Calligraphr font-creation app
items.author: Kristen Radtke
items.summary:
- **Calligraphr** is a web-based app that turns handwriting into fonts, requiring only a printer and a phone camera.
- It is **affordable**, with the paid version costing $8/month or $24/6 months.
- Kristen hosted a **font-making workshop** in March, allowing friends to create their fonts quickly and effortlessly.
- The app offers great **customization options**, including letter variants and ligature functions for cursive writing.
- Users can adjust **spacing and padding** for each letter to improve readability.
- It is recommended for anyone wanting a **handwriting font**, whether for fun or professional use.

items.title: Amazon’s new James Bond movie will be produced by Amy Pascal and David Heyman
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Amazon MGM has hired Amy Pascal and David Heyman to produce a new James Bond film.
- Pascal has previously worked on Sony’s Spider-Man franchise and multiple Bond films such as Casino Royale and Skyfall.
- Heyman produced all eight Harry Potter films and is currently involved in HBO/Max's Harry Potter reimagined series.
- Both producers expressed honor in taking stewardship of the Bond franchise, following Barbara Broccoli and Michael Wilson.
- Courtenay Valenti, head of film at Amazon MGM, emphasized the studio's responsible approach to the Bond IP.

items.title: OpenAI rolls out Sora powered by GPT-4o to ChatGPT
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- OpenAI integrates Sora’s image generation into ChatGPT, launching the feature "Images in ChatGPT" today.
- Sora will be available across all ChatGPT subscription tiers including free, but usage limits are not explicitly stated yet.
- Sora features significant improvements such as better binding of attributes and improved text rendering.
- The new model can handle 15 to 20 objects accurately without confusion, improving on previous image models.
- Users will find advantages in generating coherent text in images, enhancing overall image usability.
- The system employs an autoregressive approach for image generation, potentially enhancing text rendering capabilities.
- OpenAI is implementing safeguards to prevent misuse, such as blocking generation of explicit content.

items.title: Samsung's 3D Odyssey monitor is now available to reserve, and it might cost $2,000
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Samsung has opened preorders for its glasses-free 3D monitor, the Odyssey 3D G90XF, priced at $1,999.99.
- The 27-inch monitor features a 4K display with eye-tracking for a high-definition 3D image.
- Customers must install Samsung’s Reality Hub app for 3D gaming, optimized for certain upcoming games.
- Supports 165Hz refresh rate, 1ms response time, AMD FreeSync Premium, and Nvidia G-Sync.
- The monitor can convert content into 3D but requires an Nvidia graphics card (RTX 3080 or higher) and does not support DRM-protected content.
- Also launching are the Odyssey OLED G8 and Odyssey G9 models, with prices starting from $1,299.99.
- Preorders are available until April 8th, with a $50 credit offered for reserving the monitor.

items.title: Apple’s WWDC 2025 event starts June 9th
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) is scheduled for June 9-13, 2025, at Apple Park.
- The event will focus on updates to iOS, macOS, and potential new features for Siri.
- Last year, Apple introduced features for Siri that are still pending release, with expectations for updates possibly in iOS 19 and beyond.
- Recent updates include refreshed hardware such as iPad Air and MacBook Air, with expectations for additional products to be announced during WWDC.

items.title: Discord’s refreshed UI includes a new overlay and full dark mode
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Discord introduces a full dark mode called Onyx as part of a UI refresh for its desktop app.
- The update includes four theme options for free users and improvements to the channel list and call interface.
- New game overlay enhances performance by reducing impact on frame rates and includes customizable widgets similar to Xbox Game Bar.

items.title: Hoto’s handy, rechargeable tools are up to 50 percent off
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Hoto electric screwdriver available for $34.99 during the [Amazon Big Spring Sale](https://www.theverge.com/tech/634880/amazon-big-spring-sale-march-2025-prime-day-deals-shop).
- The screwdriver is USB-C rechargeable, includes 25 steel bits, and comes with a carrying case.
- Sale lasts through March 31st; other Hoto products, such as a rechargeable power drill, also discounted by $40.
- A handheld vacuum, normally $109.99, is discounted to $57.98 during the sale, featuring multiple attachments and dual functions.

items.title: Sony brings more premium features to its budget wireless earbuds
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Sony announces the WF-C710N, a successor to the WF-C700N wireless earbuds.
- New features include improved active noise cancellation and longer battery life (8.5 hours with ANC on, up to 40 hours without).
- Equipped with touch sensors instead of physical buttons for music control and can connect to two Bluetooth devices.
- Quick charging allows 1 hour of playback from just 5 minutes in the case.
- Available for preorder at $119.99, same price as predecessors, in multiple colors including a new transparent blue.

items.title: Instagram is giving schools a faster way to get students’ posts taken down
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Instagram launches a Schools Partnership program to fast-track moderation reports from school districts.
- Posts flagged by participating schools will be prioritized for review and schools will be notified of actions taken.
- The program is available to middle schools and high schools in the US to tackle harmful student content.
- Schools will receive a profile banner and resources to help navigate Instagram safely.
- Instagram aims to comply with online child safety legislation and has previously implemented more privacy measures for teen accounts.

items.title: The Trump administration axes funding for climate impacts on health research
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The NIH will stop funding research on climate change's health impacts, as reported by ProPublica.
- The directive may halt new funding, with uncertainty regarding active grants.
- Previous funding cuts included three climate and health programs, impacting projects like the Climate Change and Health Initiative.
- Public health advocates warn this threatens efforts to protect against climate-related health risks.
- Kids born in 2024 expected to face poorer air quality and health disruptions from climate change.
- HHS claims the funding cuts align with their priorities and aim to uphold evidence-based science.

items.title: Tesla Takedown: Protests Against Elon Musk's Leadership
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Since early February, protesters have targeted Tesla in response to Elon Musk's controversial government actions.
- Protests include picketing Tesla showrooms and demands for Tesla owners to sell their vehicles.
- There are reports of vandalism, including defacing vehicles and arson against Tesla properties.
- The FBI has launched a task force to investigate the increase in violent activity directed toward Tesla.
- Musk's allies in the Trump administration are labeling these acts as domestic terrorism.
- Tesla's stock has significantly fluctuated amidst these ongoing protests and controversies, leading to concerns about the company’s future.

items.title: Apple says it’ll use Apple Maps Look Around photos to train AI
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Apple updated its website regarding the use of Look Around imagery for AI training on March 2025.
- Images collected will enhance products and services related to image recognition, creation, and enhancement.
- Look Around uses vehicles and backpacks to collect images and 3D data, ensuring privacy by blurring faces and license plates.

items.title: Samsung TV owners can finally get better 4K HDR on Netflix
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Netflix has added support for [HDR10 Plus](https://netflixtechblog.com/hdr10-now-streaming-on-netflix-c9ab1f4bd72b) for Samsung TV owners, enhancing streaming clarity and color.
- The format is now available through Netflix's Premium plan and accounts for about 50% of eligible viewing hours.
- Samsung TVs do not support Dolby Vision, leading users to rely on HDR10, which is less efficient with static metadata for lighting adjustments.
- Other platforms like [Disney Plus](https://2025/1/9/24340087/disney-plus-will-be-getting-hdr10-plus-support), [Apple TV Plus](https://support.apple.com/en-us/102339), and Prime Video have also adopted HDR10 Plus.
- Netflix aims to expand its HDR10 Plus content library to encompass all HDR titles by the end of 2025.

items.title: Ticketmaster may have violated consumer protection laws
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- The UK’s Consumer Markets Authority (CMA) is investigating Ticketmaster due to inflated pricing during Oasis reunion tour ticket sales.
- Concerns were raised about how Ticketmaster labeled tickets, particularly with 'platinum' tickets priced over twice the standard rate without justifiable perks.
- The CMA is collaborating with Ticketmaster to enhance information provided to consumers, aiming for transparency in future ticket sales.

items.title: The Bambu H2D isn’t just a bigger 3D printer — it’s a laser cutter, pen plotter, and Cricut competitor too
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The Bambu H2D is a versatile model that combines 3D printing, laser cutting, and pen plotting capabilities.
- Priced starting at $1,899, it features two 3D printing nozzles and a larger build area (350 x 320 x 325mm).
- It supports interchangeable modules such as lasers for engraving, cutting tools, and pen attachments for drawing.
- The printer can produce complex objects like an entire bicycle helmet with dual materials without filament changes.
- New AMS features include built-in heaters to dry filament, and a dual nozzle system helps minimize material waste.
- It includes safety features for laser operations and is designed to be more user-friendly with a touchscreen interface.
- Currently, the basic 3D printing modes are under evaluation for reliability with some initial quality concerns noted by testers.
- Preorders begin in June for the base model, with different combo packages available ranging up to $3,499 for full laser operation capabilities.

items.title: How Roomba got stuck
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- iRobot's Roomba, a pioneer in robot vacuum technology, faces significant challenges three decades after its launch.
- Recent episodes of The Vergecast discuss iRobot's history, its military origins, and its competition in the market.
- iRobot's attempts to reinvent Roomba and navigate competition intensify as it faces potential acquisition failures and a declining reputation.
- A conversation with Kobo's CEO highlights ongoing developments and competition in the e-reader market.
- The Vergecast also answers audience questions about finding affordable television options.

items.title: Amazon’s big spring sale is live, and here are the 50 best deals
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Amazon's Big Spring Sale runs from March 25 to March 31, 2025.
- Discounts include gardening supplies, bedding, security cameras, headphones, and smartwatches.
- Featured deals highlight products such as the Anker 140W wall charger, Google Pixel Tablet, and Blink Mini security camera.
- Competing retailers like Best Buy, Walmart, and Target also have deals during this period.

items.title: AirFly’s wireless headphone dongle adds volume controls and better sound
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Twelve South released the AirFly Pro 2 dongle for connecting wireless headphones to non-Bluetooth devices, priced at $59.99.
- Key upgrades include dedicated volume control buttons and a Qualcomm QCC3056 audio processor for improved sound quality and latency.
- Features faster pairing, multipoint connectivity for simultaneous audio streaming to two headphones, and 25 hours of battery life.

items.title: Otter’s new AI agent can speak up in meetings
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Otter launches a voice-activated AI Meeting Agent for assistance during calls and meetings.
- The Meeting Agent answers questions using company data and can schedule meetings or draft emails.
- Currently available on Zoom, with upcoming support for Microsoft Teams and Google Meet.
- Otter introduces a Sales Agent for live coaching during calls, and an SDR Agent for autonomous product demos.
- Future Agents for marketing, recruiting, and other functions are planned.

items.title: Waymo plans robotaxi launch in Washington, DC in 2026
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Waymo will launch its Waymo One ridehailing service in Washington, DC in 2026, pending legal changes for fully autonomous vehicles.
- Current city law requires human drivers for testing autonomous vehicles, prompting advocacy for legal amendments.
- Waymo's vehicles have been spotted in DC since last year, focusing on neighborhoods like Dupont Circle, Foggy Bottom, and Penn Quarter.
- The service aims to operate amid one of the worst traffic congestions in the US, with no details on vehicle numbers provided yet.
- Waymo currently operates driverless ridehailing in cities like San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Phoenix, and plans further expansions.

items.title: Nvidia’s AI assistant is here to optimize your gaming PC
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Nvidia’s AI assistant, G-Assist, was initially an April Fools’ prank in 2017, evolved into a tech demo, and is now fully functional for RTX GPU owners.
- G-Assist helps optimize game and system settings, measures frame rates, and controls lighting on connected devices.
- Users can interact with G-Assist via voice or text prompts, asking questions to receive detailed AI-generated responses.
- The assistant analyzes PCs for performance improvements and can provide recommendations on settings like overclocking and resolution adjustments.
- Requires a minimum of 12GB VRAM and nearly 10GB of local storage for the AI functions, supporting RTX 30-, 40-, and 50-series GPUs.
- Available through an update to the Nvidia app, which also introduces DLSS override options and display adjustments.

items.title: The FBI launched a task force to investigate Tesla attacks
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- The FBI has initiated a 10-person task force to investigate acts of vandalism and arson related to Tesla.
- The task force is also monitoring planned ‘Tesla Takedown’ protests scheduled for March 29, 2025.
- Incidents include finding incendiary devices at a Tesla showroom in Austin, Texas.
- Some acts are being described as domestic terrorism, influenced by statements from prominent figures including Elon Musk and former President Trump.
- There are concerns about increased surveillance authority for law enforcement over protestors due to the domestic terrorism designation.

items.title: Trump officials planned a military strike over Signal – with a magazine editor on the line
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- An editor from The Atlantic, Jeffrey Goldberg, was mistakenly added to a Signal group chat discussing military strikes on Yemen by Trump officials.
- The group chat included high-ranking members such as Vice President JD Vance and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, discussing upcoming attacks before they occurred on March 15th.
- The presence of the non-participant raised concerns about the security of discussions on classified military plans, which are not supposed to occur on consumer messaging apps like Signal.

items.title: Alleged Snowflake hacker agrees to be extradited to the US
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Connor Moucka, accused of stealing customer data from Snowflake, agreed to extradition to the US to face charges.
- Around 165 companies, including AT&T and Ticketmaster, were affected by the breaches.
- Moucka faces 20 charges, including violations of the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act, and allegedly collected $2.5 million in ransom.

items.title: Trump’s plans to save TikTok may fail to keep it online, Democrats warn
The best budget robot vacuums
Meta Quest might add single window screensharing in VR soon
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- A new "share" feature for Meta Quest VR headsets may allow users to share 2D window views with others in the virtual environment.
- The feature was spotted in the operating system's code, hinting at a tooltip text for sharing and unsharing capabilities.
- Currently, Meta Quest supports sharing VR and mixed-reality views, but not specific 2D windows.

items.title: You’ll soon be able to hear Apple Watch alarms even in silent mode
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Apple’s release candidate for watchOS 11.4 introduces a feature allowing alarms to be heard even in Silent Mode.
- Previously, the Apple Watch only provided haptic alerts in Silent Mode to maintain privacy.
- The new option, 'Break Through Silent Mode', will enable both sounds and vibrations for individual alarms, especially useful for waking up from sleep settings.
- This change addresses issues with missing alarms when Silent Mode is active, which many users, including the author, have experienced.

items.title: Best Early Deals from Amazon’s Spring Sales Event
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Amazon’s Big Spring Sale begins on March 25 and runs until March 31, 2025.
- Discounts available on various items including gardening supplies, bedding, and tech gadgets.
- Some early deals include:
  - Google Pixel Tablet for $279
  - Blink Mini security camera for $20
  - Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones for $250
  - iRobot Roomba Combo i5 for $199
- Most deals do not require a Prime subscription, allowing wider access to discounts.
- Additional recommendations include:
  - Beats Studio Pro headphones on sale for $179.95
  - Amazon Fire HD 10 tablet starting at $94.99

items.title: Apple’s iOS 18.4 update with AI-powered Priority Notifications is almost here
X’s head of engineering is out
Sony’s WH-1000XM5 wireless headphones are now available for $150 less
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- The Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones are on sale for $249.99, $150 off their regular price of $399.99, at Target for Target Circle members.
- Available in midnight blue for $328.99 on Amazon and other colors for $329.99 at Best Buy, indicating a discount of about $70.
- The headphones are praised for refined design, improved sound quality, and better active noise cancellation (ANC) compared to their predecessors, though they do not fold for easy storage.

items.title: OpenAI reshuffles leadership as Sam Altman pivots to technical focus
Alienware’s AW2725DF OLED gaming monitor is a steal at $599.99
How to delete your 23andMe data
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- 23andMe filed for bankruptcy, raising concerns about data management.
- Users can currently access and delete some of their data during Chapter 11 proceedings.
- Complete deletion of the account will result in loss of access and some data may still be retained for legal reasons.
- Steps to delete include logging into the account, verifying age, and confirming deletion via email.
- Personal data scrambling before deletion is suggested but may not be effective if data requirements are unclear.
- Deleted samples will be destroyed, though information from scientific studies will remain in use if previously consented to.

items.title: Google Drive for Windows on Arm PCs is now widely available
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google has launched its Drive app for Arm-compatible Windows PCs, previously in beta since last year.
- The app allows Windows PCs with Qualcomm’s Snapdragon processors to store, sync, and access files.
- Available exclusively for devices running Windows 11 with Microsoft WebView 2.
- Users downloaded as beta will be prompted to upgrade to the latest version from the Google Drive website.
- The launch supports increased adoption of apps on Arm64, including Google Chrome and NordVPN.

items.title: Aura digital photo frames will continue to auto-sync with Google Photos after all
Minecraft is getting vibrant with its visuals
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Mojang announced a new update called [Vibrant Visuals](https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/minecraft-vibrant-visuals) for Minecraft during the Minecraft Live event.
- The update will include dynamic lighting, improved shadows, enhanced water reflections, volumetric fog, and changes to underwater visuals.
- It will be a toggle-able feature for all players in Minecraft: Bedrock Edition and is currently in the testing phase, with plans for a rollout on Java Edition soon.

items.title: Microsoft announces security AI agents to help overwhelmed humans
